channel.title: Papers with Code: Trending (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Multiface: A Dataset for Neural Face Rendering
item.description: Along with the release of the dataset, we conduct ablation studies on the influence of different model architectures toward the model's interpolation capacity of novel viewpoint and expressions.

item.title: Multi-scale Multi-band DenseNets for Audio Source Separation
item.description: This paper deals with the problem of audio source separation.

item.title: CelebV-HQ: A Large-Scale Video Facial Attributes Dataset
item.description: Large-scale datasets have played indispensable roles in the recent success of face generation/editing and significantly facilitated the advances of emerging research fields.

item.title: DEVIANT: Depth EquiVarIAnt NeTwork for Monocular 3D Object Detection
item.description: As a result, DEVIANT is equivariant to the depth translations in the projective manifold whereas vanilla networks are not.

item.title: When Counting Meets HMER: Counting-Aware Network for Handwritten Mathematical Expression Recognition
item.description: Recently, most handwritten mathematical expression recognition (HMER) methods adopt the encoder-decoder networks, which directly predict the markup sequences from formula images with the attention mechanism.

item.title: In Defense of Online Models for Video Instance Segmentation
item.description: In recent years, video instance segmentation (VIS) has been largely advanced by offline models, while online models gradually attracted less attention possibly due to their inferior performance.

item.title: Omni3D: A Large Benchmark and Model for 3D Object Detection in the Wild
item.description: Omni3D re-purposes and combines existing datasets resulting in 234k images annotated with more than 3 million instances and 97 categories. 3D detection at such scale is challenging due to variations in camera intrinsics and the rich diversity of scene and object types.

item.title: YOLOv7: Trainable bag-of-freebies sets new state-of-the-art for real-time object detectors
item.description: YOLOv7 surpasses all known object detectors in both speed and accuracy in the range from 5 FPS to 160 FPS and has the highest accuracy 56. 8% AP among all known real-time object detectors with 30 FPS or higher on GPU V100.

item.title: Generative Multiplane Images: Making a 2D GAN 3D-Aware
item.description: What is really needed to make an existing 2D GAN 3D-aware?

item.title: RePaint: Inpainting using Denoising Diffusion Probabilistic Models
item.description: In this work, we propose RePaint: A Denoising Diffusion Probabilistic Model (DDPM) based inpainting approach that is applicable to even extreme masks.

item.title: AdaNeRF: Adaptive Sampling for Real-time Rendering of Neural Radiance Fields
item.description: However, rendering images with this new paradigm is slow due to the fact that an accurate quadrature of the volume rendering equation requires a large number of samples for each ray.

item.title: OCR-free Document Understanding Transformer
item.description: Current Visual Document Understanding (VDU) methods outsource the task of reading text to off-the-shelf Optical Character Recognition (OCR) engines and focus on the understanding task with the OCR outputs.

item.title: An Improved One millisecond Mobile Backbone
item.description: Furthermore, we show that our model generalizes to multiple tasks - image classification, object detection, and semantic segmentation with significant improvements in latency and accuracy as compared to existing efficient architectures when deployed on a mobile device.

item.title: XMem: Long-Term Video Object Segmentation with an Atkinson-Shiffrin Memory Model
item.description: We present XMem, a video object segmentation architecture for long videos with unified feature memory stores inspired by the Atkinson-Shiffrin memory model.

item.title: SpA-Former: Transformer image shadow detection and removal via spatial attention
item.description: In this paper, we propose an end-to-end SpA-Former to recover a shadow-free image from a single shaded image.

item.title: Neural-Sim: Learning to Generate Training Data with NeRF
item.description: However, existing approaches either require human experts to manually tune each scene property or use automatic methods that provide little to no control; this requires rendering large amounts of random data variations, which is slow and is often suboptimal for the target domain.

item.title: Panoptic Scene Graph Generation
item.description: Existing research addresses scene graph generation (SGG) -- a critical technology for scene understanding in images -- from a detection perspective, i. e., objects are detected using bounding boxes followed by prediction of their pairwise relationships.

item.title: Ivy: Templated Deep Learning for Inter-Framework Portability
item.description: We introduce Ivy, a templated Deep Learning (DL) framework which abstracts existing DL frameworks.

item.title: Demystifying MMD GANs
item.description: We investigate the training and performance of generative adversarial networks using the Maximum Mean Discrepancy (MMD) as critic, termed MMD GANs.

item.title: Collaborative Neural Rendering using Anime Character Sheets
item.description: Drawing images of characters at desired poses is an essential but laborious task in anime production.
